items.name: Lens-Maker's Glasses
items.description: Gain 10% chance for hits to 'Critically Strike', dealing double damage.

notes: Critical strikes are reflected by a sharper hit sound and a red tint on the damage numbers.
Crit chance is affected by Luck.
Effective stacking limit is 10 stacks for 100% crit chance.
Items increasing crit chance synergize with others like Harvester's Scythe or Predatory Instincts.

corruption.modifier: Transforms existing Lens-Maker's Glasses into Lost Seer's Lenses.

notes: Blocks incoming damage, including self-inflicted effects.
Hyperbolic stacking limits actual block chance, reducing effectiveness with more stacks.
Cannot block Void Reaver implosions or Void Fog damage.

corruption.modifier: Blocks damage once every few seconds instead of probabilistic chance.

notes: Grants additional jumps beneficial for Survivors with low mobility.
Extra jumps are not affected by Wax Quail.
Engineer’s TR58 Carbonizer Turrets will not use Hopoo Feathers.

items.name: Weeping Fungus
items.description: Heal while sprinting. Corrupts all Bustling Fungi.

notes: Healing happens twice per second, splitting the HP gain into two ticks of +1% each.
Sprinting is required for healing.
Particularly effective for Survivors with the Agile keyword in their abilities.
Engineer’s stationary turrets and TR58 Carbonizer Turrets do not benefit from this item.

corruption.modifier: Transforms Bustling Fungi into Weeping Fungus.

items.name: Mocha
items.description: Slightly increase attack speed and movement speed.

notes: Mocha provides buffs equal to half of those granted by Soldier's Syringe (Attack Speed) and Paul's Goat Hoof (Movement Speed).

items.name: Infusion
items.description: Killing an enemy permanently increases your maximum health, up to 100.

notes: When an enemy is killed, the player gains bonus health through a red particle effect.
Turrets spawned by Engineer benefit from Infusion, but only gain health from their own kills.
Bonus health is lost if Infusions are removed but restored if the item is regained.
If Glass is active, the health-to-kill ratio changes from 1:1 to 1:10.
This is not considered a healing item (e.g., for the Naturopath challenge).
Destroying certain destructible objects in levels can also trigger Infusion (e.g., explosive pots, Alloy Vulture Nests).
Additional stacks of Infusion provide an effective health-per-kill gain of 0.5.
